result.execSummary:
The defendant Mina B Cleereman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mina B Cleereman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:41 AM. State - here for a change of plea. Joy and Cleereman agree. Joy - plead g/nc to count #1, #2 and #6, 12 months probation. State - count #1 will be a $300.00 fine plus costs, counts #2 and #6 - place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: court costs, AODA, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar Class B establishments, 40 hours of community service, remaining counts to be DRI, no employment condition as she is currently employed. Joy and Cleereman agree but Cleereman makes statement that she thought it was for just for resisting or paraphanalia and was just informed of the plea offer yesterday. Court addresses and asks questions of defense counsel. Recess at 8:55 AM to discuss with client.  Back on record at 9:03 AM with same appearances. Joy - makes a record of the defendant's wishes - asking Court to set the matter for another JT. Cleereman states that she came here today to accept the plea offer but was not aware of the complete agreement. State responds. Court asks the defendant if she is rejecting the plea and not willing to enter it today. Joy states that she was ready to plea but does not believe it would be knowing, freely and intelligently. Court goes thru that collaquey with the defendant and what it needs to find in order to accept the plea and her right to JT. Cleereman now states that she is willing to take the plea. Joy makes statement, does not want to break attorney/client privilege. Court makes sure the defendant knows that she will not be punished for taking the matter to trial. Recess again to talk to client (9:17 AM). Back on the record at 9:27 AM with same appearances. Joy - defendant will accept the offer from the State and believes it is a very informed decision. Cleereman agrees. Joy and Cleereman understand what the agreement is and is willing to proceed with it today. Court informs defendant what is means for a count to be dismissed and read in. Court dismisses and reads in counts #3, #4 and #5. Cleereman pleads NC to counts #1, #2 and #6 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cleereman withholds statement.  Court has read all of the character references that it was provided -  sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO; counts #2 and #6 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 40 hours of community service, costs on each count - 60 DTP/CO, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
from Attorney Joy informing Court that the defendant will be pleading and not going to JT
Jury trial on January 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mina B Cleereman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:30 AM. State - here for FPT. Joy - not resolved, has gone over Frye with the defendant, just received some discovery today (large number of photographs). State - just received a supplemental packet so provided it to Joy. Court continues bond, set for JT. State - offer - plead to count #5 and #6, dismiss and read on other counts, 1 year probation. Cleereman does reject that offer.  Jury trial scheduled for January 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 3, 2016 at 09:15 am.
No consumption of alcohol, sign and return bond within 10 days to Clerk of Court's Office.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:52 AM. Joy has filed an auth to appear, has complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas, set for FPT. Court accepts auth to appear, accepts plea, set for FPT. Joy - bond - asks for signature bond. State - bond - no objections. Court - bond - $1000.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, refund bond to poster.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 09:15 am.
